message.content: {"id": "102436", "title": "Bug 102436: Date/time value not stored correctly in report design", "description": "An invalid date/time string (which does not conform to a universal format or the system default locale format) should have been rejected in the report design, but it is not.", "OB": "The report designer is not properly validating the format of the date/time string when setting the default value for a 'DateTime' type report parameter.", "EB": "The report designer should reject any invalid date/time string that does not conform to a universal format or the system default locale format when setting the default value for a 'DateTime' type report parameter.", "SR": "To reproduce this issue, open the BIRT report designer and create a new 'DateTime' type report parameter. In the 'default value' field, enter an invalid date string, such as '55/66/9999'."}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '102436', 'title': 'Bug 102436Date/time value not stored correctly in report design', 'description': 'Bug 102436Date/time value not stored correctly in report design An invaliddate/time string (which does not conform to a univeral format or the systemdefault locale format) should have been rejected. ', 'OB': '', 'EB': '', 'SR': 'New a "DateTime" type report parameter in BIRT report designer, in the "defaultvalue" field, type in some invalid date string, say "55/66/9999". '}
